issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: environment variables in eucarc files are suppose to become obsolete some time soon.
fields.summary: esi-* tools should not only use environment varialbes

comments.body: Given the situation with euca2ools, what release would you tie this work to, [~gholms]?

Comment from gholms:

I would consider this quite important for 4.2, as it keeps us from elimination eucarc/zip files. Maybe not a blocker, but it will complicate installation if postponed.
Raised the priority on this because it causes issues during installation.  An example of this can be seen in EUCA-11390.
Raised priority on this to blocker due to the status of EUCA-11390.

[~hspencer], I think you missed the "not only" in the name of the bug. Tool now uses output from euca-generate-enviroment-config and not env variables set by user. If evn variables trump settings in config files and you think this is not valid please file a separate bug on that.

[~vasya],

Apologies.  Thanks for the clarification.  I thought all the tools were moving away from global environment variables.  I will re-verify.
